title: Class Dismissed: Characters
description:
Take a little sketch comedy.  Throw in some improv and mix in a little dance as well, and you'll have the wackiest graduation show you've ever seen.

The students of the Character Workshop have been working with Push co-founder Brad McMurran to create some amazing and hilarious new characters.

Don't miss the fruits of their labor.

Sunday at 6pm.

Class Dismissed: Characters

Sunday, June 16th at 6pm

Tickets are $5
full_description:
Take a little sketch comedy. Throw in some improv and mix in a little dance as well, and you'll have the wackiest graduation show you've ever seen.

The students of the Character Workshop have been working with Push co-founder Brad McMurran to create some amazing and hilarious new characters.

Don't miss the fruits of their labor.

Sunday at 6pm.

Class Dismissed: Characters

Sunday, June 16th at 6pm

Tickets are $5

title: Harold Night
description:
It's Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is the big, bad grand daddy of all long form improv! It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

Harold Night

Free show!!!

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.



--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

Free show!!!

title: Always Be Comedy a Sketch Comedy Show
description:
ComicKaze presents the last sketch comedy show ever.  To be clear: we don't mean the last ComicKaze sketch comedy show, but THE LAST SKETCH COMEDY SHOW BY ANYONE EVER.

We’re not saying the world is going to end. We’re just saying, if you ever want to see a sketch comedy show before the oblivion takes us all, this is the one.

So say goodbye to your loved ones, finish up that bucket list, and then come to the funniest sketch comedy show you’ll see before we’re all consumed by fire!

ComicKaze: The comedy you deserve.

--------

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.

Featuring members of Short & Sweet, Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls, and On the House, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.

title: The Living Room
description:
We invite you into The Living Room.

What goes together better than oversharing and improv comedy?

Based on your suggestion, a group of improv comedians will share real stories from their life and then use those as inspiration to jump into comedy scenes made up right on the spot! TRUE STORY! Will it get too personal? Will it get awkward? Will that lead to hilariousness? PROBABLY, DEFINITELY, AND YES!!!

What goes together better than oversharing and improv comedy?

The Living Room

Friday, June 21st at 10pm

The Living Room

Friday, June 21st at 10pm

title: Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire
description:
Winter is coming to the Push Comedy Theater!!!

Are you sad Game of Thrones is over?  Disappointed about how Season 8 turned out?  Don't worry... we are here for you.

Nerdvana and the Push Comedy Theater are proud to present Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire.

It's a night of fully-improvised, comedy set in the world of Game of Thrones.  We'll have violence, betrayals and dragons!  All made up right in front of your eyes.  See how Season 8 should have turned out.

There will be a Game of Thrones trivia contest during intermission with some cool prizes.

Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire

Saturday, June 22nd at 8pm

Tickets are $10

**Like Game of Thrones, this show is not for the kids.

---

Nerdvana is a new show at the Push Comedy Show. It's a comedy show for nerds, by nerds. We lovingly poke fun at some of our favorite sci-fi and fantasy books, tv shows and movies. Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Doctor Who and more... nothing is safe. If you are a fan of all things nerd, you'll love this show.

It's a night of fully-improvised, comedy set in the world of Game of Thrones. We'll have violence, betrayals and dragons! All made up right in front of your eyes. See how Season 8 should have turned out.

There will be a Game of Thrones trivia contest during intermission with some cool prizes.

Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire

Saturday, June 22nd at 8pm

Tickets are $10

**Like Game of Thrones, this show is not for the kids.

title: ​Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls presents Wishful Thinking
description:
Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls presents Wishful Thinking

We’ve got three wishes and an hour to use them! Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls is proud to present “Wishful Thinking”! Join us as we stumble through the aftermath of wishing for our deepest darkest desires and singalong as we butcher our way through at least one Aladdin parody.

Sketch Me Like One Of Your French Girls is a sketch comedy group based out of Norfolk, VA. We're a group of pals who write well together and really know how to pull off a beret.

Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls presents Wishful Thinking

Saturday, June 22nd at 10pm

Tickets are $10

title: The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show
description:
Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.

The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show

The last Friday of every month, 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: The Improv Riot After Dark: The Short Form Improv Show
description:
It's your favorite short-form improv show... with a twist.

The Improv Riot After Dark takes all your fun improv games and gives them an adult spin.  Where the regular Improv Riot tries to stay PG13ish, Improv Riot After Dark will definitely be R rated.

title: Fake News The Musical
description:
Ripped from today's headlines!!!!

Fake News the Musical is a fully improvised, musical news show. The audience supplies the headlines, we sing the news.

The day's top stories never sounded so good.

Don't miss this amazing show as they debut a brand new cast.

Fake News the Musical

Tickets are $5.

title: IMPROVAGEDDON: THE ULTIMATE IMPROV COMPETITION
description:
Prepare for Glory!!

Prepare for IMPROVAGEDDON: The Ultimate Improv Competition!!!

Who will raise the Hammer of Lowell in final victory? You'll have to come to this month's show to find out!

3 teams will be given just 15 minutes to perform any style of improv comedy they choose... all in a quest to be declared Improvageddon champ and raise the Hammer of Lowell in final victory.

This ain't your daddy's Improv cage match! If you think you've seen Improv competitions before then you ain't seen nothin yet!

Improvageddon combines Improv Comedy with stylistic elements of Professional Wrestling to create a truly unique, and most definitely over-the-top Improv contest.

Gimmicks will be displayed! Trash will be talked! Feats of comedic strength will be performed!

Let the final war for comedic supremacy begin!

IMPROVAGEDDON: The Ultimate Improv Competition!The last Saturday of every month

The show starts at 10:00pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Improvised Fairy Tale: A Kid Friendly Comedy Show
description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an “Improvised Fairy Tale.”  Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month. Children in costume get in for free!“The Improvised Fairy Tale” is part of the Children’s Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm.  The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.
full_description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an “Improvised Fairy Tale.” Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month. Children in costume get in for free!

“The Improvised Fairy Tale” is part of the Children’s Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm. The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.

title: Musical Harold Night
description:
***SPECIAL NIGHT AND TIME***

June 30th at 7pm

*******************************



The Harold is one of the oldest and most lauded forms of long-form improv.  Using a single audience suggestion as inspiration, each team creates a 25-minute run of scenes exploring a world of interconnected characters and ideas.

We're turning the Harold on it's ear, with music!!!

Don't miss... Musical Harold Night!!!  It's the Harold you know and love, now with music.  You'll see big opening and closing numbers, scenes and songs all made up on the spot.

Musical Harold Night comes to the Push Comedy Theater.

The first Thursday of the month at 8pm.
full_description:
***SPECIAL NIGHT AND TIME***

June 30th at 7pm

*******************************


The Harold is one of the oldest and most lauded forms of long-form improv. Using a single audience suggestion as inspiration, each team creates a 25-minute run of scenes exploring a world of interconnected characters and ideas.

We're turning the Harold on it's ear, with music!!!

Don't miss... Musical Harold Night!!! It's the Harold you know and love, now with music. You'll see big opening and closing numbers, scenes and songs all made up on the spot.

Musical Harold Night comes to the Push Comedy Theater.

The first Thursday of the month at 8pm.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

Friday, July 5th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play!
description:
Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play is a group of five good friends with over 50 years of stage & improv experience looking to make you laugh your ass off!

Here's how our show works:

We ask the audience for any song lyric (except "Hit me, baby, one more time." Ew.) With that one lyrical suggestion, we will improvise an entire one-act play!

We come up with big, funny characters and compelling storylines right in front of your eyes. It may be dramatic, maybe even a little tragic, but it's always funny (we are dipshits)!

Our show may look like we rehearsed it somehow, but we promise you there is no script. Just lots of laughs & lots of fun!

Comedy! Drama! Spectacle! Monocle!Monocle: The Improvised One-Act PlayFirst Friday of the month at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 10 pm, tickets are $5

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Tales from the Campfire: The Improvised Ghost Story
description:
I ain't afraid of no ghost!

The Push presents a frightful night of comedy (or is it a hilarious night of frights).

Tales from the Campfire is quickly becoming one of the Push's biggest hits.



With an audience suggestion, this talented group of improvisers will make up a series of gut-busting ghost story right before your eyes.



Tales from the Campfire: The Improvised Ghost Story

First Saturday of the month at 8pm

Tickets are $10

title: SKETCHMAGEDDON: The Ultimate Sketch Comedy Competition
description:
Last month, Sketch Me Outside did what no other team has  done... won 5 Sketchmageddons in a row.  Can anyone defeat them???

--

Get ready for a sketch comedy show like no other!!!

SKETCHMAGEDDON takes three groups and forces them to compete in an all-out comedy deathmatch!

Each team will be given 15 minutes to dazzle you with their comedy prowess. It's Saturday Night Live meets Thunderdome!!!!

Unlike its improvised sister show IMPROVAGEDDON, SKETCHMAGEDDON features all written and rehearsed material.  Props, costumes, and special effects are all legal in SKETCHMAGEDDON.

This is a completely experimental show.  You never know what you are going to see.

SKETCHMAGEDDON: The Ultimate Sketch Comedy Competition

The first Saturday of the month at 10pm.

Tickets are $5

------------

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.
full_description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Second Saturday Stand-Up
description:
Second Saturday Stand-Up

This once-a-month show is hosted by almost-jaded veteran comic Hatton Jordan who sets the lineup with proven comedians delivering road-tested jokes while they squeeze in new material.

This is NOT a "open mic" .....it's selected talent working on their craft. Every month is a new seasoned lineup.

Every show 90 minutes.

Host: Hatton Jordan

Line up: TBA

Saturday, July 13h at 10pm

title: Sketch Comedy Writing 201
description:
This is where it gets real!!!!

This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101. The class will focus on developing comedic characters, parody and building their own, unique show

At the end of the session, students sketches will be performed on the Push Comedy Theater stage by some of Hampton Roads finest actors.

This class will be held from 6:30-9:30pm on Wednesday nights.

July 17th thru August 14th at the Push Comedy Theater.

This is a 5 week class.  Students are encouraged to bring sketches and sketch ideas to the first class.

Price: $175



$60 for students taking Sketch 201 a second time.

title: The 5 “Artists” You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)
description:
The 5 “Artists” You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)

You could pay $11 for a decent meal and you would poop it out later and your $11 will be gone forever. BUT you could pay $11, change a life just by meeting some artsy people and not resent your poop.

If you went to Art Grad School you met these people.

If you didn’t go to Art Grad school but you shared a campus with them, you met these people.

If you’ve ever seen art on a coffee shop wall or a poster about their upcoming art show on a coffee shop wall or ever just walked into a coffee shop with a coffee shop wall you’ve met these people in one way or another.

You don’t have to be an artist to meet artists. You’ve met them already. You can meet them all over again from the safety of an audience seat (and somewhere other than a coffee shop).

This one-woman show will isolate and re-introduce those 5 artists that you met (or didn’t meet) (or haven’t met yet), poke fun at itself and at the artists portrayed in each category of the contemporary artist.

Disclaimer: the artist working today and not necessarily just contemporary art (as in the movement) because who has ever actually MET contemporary art or a movement in a coffee shop?

Despite these 5 artist’s best efforts to be the unique, non-conforming individualist, what unites them is that everybody is really unique in their own artsy way. This one-woman show will let you see inside their uniqueness. (and maybe into yours)

(Art Grad School Graduate Disclaimer about being the unique, non-confirming individualist: in grad school it’s very rare that anyone actually wants to sit down with you in your “studio”, listen to you drone on about your craft and why this piece is working or that piece isn’t working while sipping overpriced coffee from a bodega. It’s even more rare that they occasionally mumble thought-provoking questions in the abstract under their breath while you stammer and stumble about, grabbing sketches of this or that and shuffling through drawings while being fueled by anxiety and a need for a nugget of feedback on who you are and what your work means.)

Sorry, but nobody does that anymore. But we “Artists” try anyway. Out here grinding, y'all.

<Value Add Statement added for effect and also a Call to Action>

If you pay $11 for this performance, you will come away with empathy for the actress as she continually embarrasses herself. This show will make you feel better about your life, maybe forever.

Whether you’re a 9 to 5’er in a secure job with paid over time and benefits or a post art grad school person, or a self-educated artist or just a creative in general, if you are a really successful lawyer or business owner- it doesn't matter what you do. This show will make everyone appreciate parts of themselves and their lives.

You’re going to like the way you feel, I guarantee it. (but also no refunds, so…)

The 5 “Artists” You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)

Friday, July 19th, 8pm

Tickets $11
